title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Braginsky M, Mathur M (2023). metabias: Meta-Analysis Within-Study /Across-Study Biases. https://github.com/mathurlabstanford/metabias, https://mathurlabstanford.github.io/metabias.
code: @Manual{,   title = {metabias: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases},   author = {Mika Braginsky and Maya Mathur},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/mathurlabstanford/metabias, https://mathurlabstanford.github.io/metabias}, }

what: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases
title: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases
text: metabias provides common components (classes, methods, documentation) packages conduct meta-analytic corrections sensitivity analyses within-study /across-study biases meta-analysis. user packages, unlikely need use package directly. See packages: - PublicationBias - phacking - multibiasmeta

title: metabias S3 class — metabias-class
text: object class metabias result fitting one models dataset one row per study meta-analyzed. models either (1) meta-analysis correction one within-study across-study biases, (2) sensitivity analysis meta-analyses respect biases. Examples functions return objects include: PublicationBias::pubbias_meta() PublicationBias::pubbias_svalue() phacking::phacking_meta() multibiasmeta::multibias_meta() multibiasmeta::multibias_evalue()

title: metabias S3 class — metabias-class
code: metabias(   data = data.frame(),   values = list(),   stats = data.frame(),   fits = list() )  new_metabias(x = list())  # S3 method for metabias summary(object, ...)

title: metabias S3 class — metabias-class
text: data Dataframe containing data used fit model(s), added columns values computed model fitting. values List values arguments passed function. stats Dataframe summary statistics model fit(s). fits List fitted objects (class depends underlying fitting methods, e.g. robumeta::robu rstan::stanfit). x List elements "data", "values", "stats", "fits". object Object class metabias. ... used.

title: metabias S3 class — metabias-class
text: object class metabias, consists list containing elements data, values, stats, fits (corresponding arguments passed).

what: metabias: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases — metabias-package
title: metabias: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases — metabias-package
text: Provides common components (classes, methods, documentation) packages conduct meta-analytic corrections sensitivity analyses within-study /across-study biases meta-analysis. See packages 'PublicationBias', 'phacking', 'multibiasmeta'. package implement methods described , respectively: Mathur & VanderWeele (2020) doi:10.31219/osf.io/s9dp6 ; Mathur (2022) doi:10.31219/osf.io/ezjsx ; Mathur (2022) doi:10.31219/osf.io/u7vcb .

title: metabias: Meta-Analysis for Within-Study and/or Across-Study Biases — metabias-package
text: Maintainer: Mika Braginsky mika.br@gmail.com Authors: Maya Mathur mmathur@stanford.edu

what: Documentation for params common across metabias packages. — params
title: Documentation for params common across metabias packages. — params
text: Documentation params common across metabias packages.

title: Documentation for params common across metabias packages. — params
text: yi vector point estimates meta-analyzed. vi vector estimated variances (.e., squared standard errors) point estimates. sei vector estimated standard errors point estimates. (one vi sei needs specified). cluster Vector length number rows data, indicating cluster study considered part (defaults treating studies independent; .e., study cluster). favor_positive TRUE publication bias assumed favor significant positive estimates; FALSE assumed favor significant negative estimates. alpha_select Alpha level estimate's probability favored publication bias assumed change (.e., threshold study investigators, journal editors, etc., consider estimate significant). ci_level Confidence interval level (proportion) corrected point estimate. (alpha level inference corrected point estimate calculated ci_level.) small inference allow small meta-analysis? recommend always using TRUE. selection_ratio Ratio publication bias favors affirmative studies (.e., studies p-values less alpha_select estimates direction indicated favor_positive). q attenuated value shift point estimate CI. specified scale yi (e.g., yi log-RR scale, q well).

title: robumeta::robu CI — robu_ci
text: Add confidence interval reg_table robumeta::robu object.

title: robumeta::robu CI — robu_ci
text: robu_fit Object class robumeta::robu. ci_level Confidence level use confidence interval (defaults 0.95).

title: robumeta::robu CI — robu_ci
text: dataframe columns estimate, se, ci_lower, ci_upper, p_value.

title: robumeta::robu CI — robu_ci
code: # example model from robumeta::robu() hier_mod <- robumeta::robu(effectsize ~ binge + followup + sreport + age,                            data = robumeta::hierdat, studynum = studyid,                            var.eff.size = var, modelweights = "HIER",                            small = TRUE) robu_ci(hier_mod) #>          param    estimate           se     ci_lower    ci_upper    p_value #> 1 X.Intercept.  0.39695130 0.6580061223 -1.675340360 2.469242958 0.58816304 #> 2        binge  0.45158407 0.1016414122  0.156275299 0.746892833 0.01438447 #> 3     followup  0.00133090 0.0007225729 -0.001731258 0.004393058 0.20481776 #> 4      sreport  0.53875845 0.1433975062  0.153235110 0.924281796 0.01696253 #> 5          age -0.04371413 0.0378744671 -0.172347635 0.084919375 0.34044554
